originalText.text: The staff is exceptional which makes it a great visit overall. Been going to this practice for over 20 years. I‚Äôm a very picky person so this says a lot. The office is always clean so that‚Äôs also a plus. Knowledgeable staff in every way.

originalText.text: I recently moved to New York.  Today was my first appointment at Morningside Dental Care.  The staff was friendly, engaging and professional. The office is bright, clean and organized.  My first visit was more than I could have expected.  Extremely pleased to have found my dental home.

text.text: I recently moved to New York.  Today was my first appointment at Morningside Dental Care.  The staff was friendly, engaging and professional. The office is bright, clean and organized.  My first visit was more than I could have expected.  Extremely pleased to have found my dental home.

originalText.text: A longer than usual but sorely needed visit. Malaika was as careful as ever and listened to my life rant before examining my teeth. It had been a year since I was in her chair (I had misrembered my visit schedule and thought at least one of my children's visits was mine in the past six months) . So I expected the worst. She did my cleaning in record time and was kind about my super poor habits of late (not enough flossing).  But she also suspected that I'd been grinding my teeth. So she did a whole work up (I forget the name of the test) with a head x ray machine, mini model and visuals, then the sleep test ring which I have to wear for three nights. They had asked me to consider it in visits past, but somehow it all came together today.  Thanks to Manny and a newer staffer, Diamond - I think that's her name - at the front desk too. They kept all the steps easy breezy. So I was there longer than expected for a cleaning, but I got a lot more and it was worth it.

originalText.text: They started to check my mouth and only did portion x-rays. The dentist and hygienist left me sitting there for about 5minutes after starting to work on my mouth. Then they have me speak to the person in charge of billing to them tell me I had to pay $55 for 2 fillings when my insurance covers that 100%. I explained that I shouldn‚Äôt have any payment due and she said that this was interesting and it may be a fee. She then had the audacity to ask me if I still want a cleaning. No thank you. The dentist seemed as if she was unsure of what to do to my teeth that was hurting. I prefer a dentist and staff that are more professional and confident in their work.
